edu.ucsf.ModelProjector

Class ModelProjectorLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsf.ModelProjector.ModelProjectorLauncher

  • public class ModelProjectorLauncher
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates maps by projecting a set of selected models into geographic space using rasters of environmental (and other) data.
    Author:
    Joshua Ladau, jladau@gmail.com

      static void main(java.lang.String[] rgsArgs)
      Writes rasters with maps of predicted values (e.g., relative abundance) using a set of models and rasters of environmental or other data.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] rgsArgs)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes rasters with maps of predicted values (e.g., relative abundance) using a set of models and rasters of environmental or other data.
        Parameters:
        Arguments - pass as --{argument name}={argument value}. Name-value pairs are:

        Required arguments

        • sBIOMPath [string] = Absolute path to a file containing an OTU table. File should be in BIOM format (HDF5). Should include 'latitude', 'longitude', 'datetime', and optionally 'vert' sample metadata fields.

        • sOutputPath [string] = Path to where output raster should be written.

        • sSelectedModelsPath [string] = Path output from ModelSelector to be projected. Should include header. First model will be projected unless iInputLine is specified (see below).

        Optional arguments

        • sSampleMetadataPath [string] [OPTIONAL] = Path to text file containing sample metadata formatted according to http://biom-format.org/documentation/adding_metadata.html. For use if BIOM file does not contain metadata. Must include 'id', 'datetime' and 'latitude', 'longitude' or 'x','y' fields

        • sSamplesToKeepPath [string] [OPTIONAL] = Path to file with list of samples to keep. File should contain a list of sample names, one per line.

        • sObservationsToKeepPath [string] [OPTIONAL] = Path to file with list of observations to keep. File should contain a list of observation names.

        • bCheckRarefied [boolean] [OPTIONAL] = Flag for whether to check for rarefaction. If enabled and table is not rarefied, error will be thrown. Default is true.

        • iRarefactionTotal [integer] [OPTIONAL] = Total count to which to rarefy samples.

        • bNormalize [boolean] [OPTIONAL] = Flag for whether to normalize within each sample so that entries total to 1.

        • sMaskPath [string] [OPTIONAL] = Absolute path to shapefile used for masking output maps.

        • sTrainingDatesPath [string] [OPTIONAL] = File listing sample IDs and date (YYYY-MM-DD) to be used for loading training values. Headers should be "SampleID, Date." If this argument is unspecified, dates of sample collection is used.

        • sMaskFeature [string] [OPTIONAL] = Name of header for feature to use in masking output maps.

        • sMaskFeatureID [string] [OPTIONAL] = Name of feature to use for masking output maps.

        • rgtProjectionTimes [list of dates] [OPTIONAL] = Comma-delimited list of of times to project to. Times should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Use 9999 if no year is specified (e.g., 9999-7-15). Omit if all environmental rasters are not temporally resolved.

        • dProjectionVert [doubles] [OPTIONAL] = Elevations to project to. Defaults to 0. Omit if all environmental rasters are not elevation-specific.

        • iBootstrapRandomSeed [integer] [OPTIONAL] = Random seed for bootstrapping training data. Defaults is no bootstrapping.

        • iInputLine [integer] [OPTIONAL] = Input line from ModelSelector output. Defaults to 1. Zero-based.

        • sMergeSamplesPath [string] [OPTIONAL] = Path to file for merging samples with the following headers: sample_id_old, sample_id_new, latitude_new, longitude_new, datetime_new.

        • sOutputMode [string] [OPTIONAL] = flag for whether to output map ("map"; default) or predictions only for sampling locations ("samplepredictions").
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
